result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadrach H Acevedo Davalos

defendant.name: Acevedo Davalos, Sadrach H
defendant.address: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
9:50 AM Defendant Sadrach H Acevedo Davalos in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Sadrach H Acevedo Davalos.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
City of Waukesha police officer Nathan Smidt sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Sitzberger.  Cross examination by Atty. Miller.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Sitzberger moves for bind over.  Atty. Miller makes closing statements.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Dennis P Moroney on 10/17/2022.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sadrach H Acevedo Davalos
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 1906 Madera Street, #5, Waukesha, WI 53189

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A (EXCEPTION: unless they initiate contact or in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Sadrach H Acevedo Davalos in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Sadrach H Acevedo Davalos. 

Attorney Herbers states that the Defendant's first name is Hector not Sadrach as that is his middle name.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
